titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dutch Homesteads exhibit photograph collection V1974.035
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T12:03-0500

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn Historical Society (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Dutch Homestead exhibit photograph collection contains 12 items which range in date from circa 1879 to 1975. The photographs were part of a Brooklyn Historical Society exhibit on Dutch homesteads, circa late 1980s. The collection contains photographs of prominent Dutch homes in Brooklyn, such as the Schenck, Wyckoff, Lefferts, and Van Pelt houses. The neighborhoods of Canarsie, Bushwick, and Gowanus are documented in the collection. Also included is a cabinet card of Rev. Henry Ward Beecher.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All items in this collection will enter the public domain by 2095. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Dutch Homesteads exhibit photograph collection, V1974.035, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Images of Dutch homesteads in Brooklyn are also available in the Dutch in New York lantern slide collection, V1974.024, and the Brooklyn historic houses slide collection, V1974.038.
